unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Science Club
question_text: A high school has four grade levels: Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, and Senior. The school is divided equally among these grades, with $25\%$ of the students in each grade level. A survey of $60$ participants in the school's science club shows the following distribution: Grade Level Number of Participants Freshman $18$ Sophomore $22$ Junior $12$ Senior $8$ If the science club has $240$ members, which of the following questions would best help determine if the participation in the science club among different grade levels is random?

choices.text: Are Sophomores more likely to join extracurriculars than Freshmen?
Given the school's distribution, what's the expected club participation by grade?
How do science club numbers correlate with other school club participation?
Is the ratio of Juniors to Seniors in the club similar to that in the school?
Does the science club have a cap limit on members from each grade?
